inference:
The sum of the angles in a triangle is 180 degrees. So, $6x^\circ + x^\circ+3x^\circ =180^\circ.$

Combining like terms, $10x^\circ=180^\circ,$ so $x^\circ =18^\circ.$

The largest angle is $6x^\circ,$ so the largest angle is $6(18^\circ) = 108^\circ.$

Final Answer: $\boxed{108^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Since the sum of the angles in a triangle is $180^\circ,$ then  \begin{align*}
3x^\circ + x^\circ + 6x^\circ &= 180^\circ \\
10x &= 180 \\
x & = 18.
\end{align*}The largest angle in the triangle is $$6x^\circ = 6(18^\circ)=\boxed{108}^\circ.$$

question:

ground_truth:
Since the sum of the angles in a triangle is $180^\circ,$ then  \begin{align*}
3x^\circ + x^\circ + 6x^\circ &= 180^\circ \\
10x &= 180 \\
x & = 18.
\end{align*}The largest angle in the triangle is $$6x^\circ = 6(18^\circ)=\boxed{108}^\circ.$$
